title: Pointless warnings from download-url
body:
#### What is the problem?
`download-url` spits out warnings about a missing cookie db, when there is none needed.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Run the following in a fresh dataset with a sub dir `some`:
```
% datalad download-url https://github.com/datalad/example-dicom-functional/raw/master/events.tsv --path some/events.tsv --message "Add events from github"
[INFO   ] Downloading 'https://github.com/datalad/example-dicom-functional/raw/master/events.tsv' into '/tmp/test-demo/some/events.tsv' 
[WARNING] Failed to open cookies DB /home/ben/.config/datalad/cookies: db type could not be determined [__init__.py:open:88] 
[WARNING] Failed to check for having a cookie for https://github.com/datalad/example-dicom-functional/raw/master/events.tsv: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable [cookies.py:__contains__:89] 
```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

0.12.0rc1
